questions.question_text: Which technology is leveraged in the NSX Edge for fast packet processing?
Which NSX CLI command is used to change the authentication policy for local users?

discussion.content:
This question should be choose 3.
This is from : https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-T-Data-Center/3.0/administration/GUID-E9B40B40-D0C4-4CC9-9706-E9C153FF1A6C.html

Tier-0 NAT
A tier-0 logical router in active-standby mode supports source NAT (SNAT), destination NAT (DNAT) and reflexive NAT. A tier-0 logical router in active-active mode supports reflexive NAT only.

When a tier-0 logical router is running in active-active mode, you cannot configure stateful NAT where asymmetrical paths might cause issues. For active-active routers, you can configure reflexive NAT (sometimes called stateless NAT).

C is correct
A tier-0 logical router in active-active mode supports reflexive NAT only
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-T-Data-Center/3.0/administration/GUID-E9B40B40-D0C4-4CC9-9706-E9C153FF1A6C.html

Answer: reflexive NAT

Ref: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-T-Data-Center/2.4/administration/GUID-E9B40B40-D0C4-4CC9-9706-E9C153FF1A6C.html

Tier-0 NAT
A tier-0 logical router in active-standby mode supports source NAT (SNAT), destination NAT (DNAT) and reflexive NAT. 
A tier-0 logical router in active-active mode supports reflexive NAT only.

I agree: C
"When a tier-0 or tier-1 logical router is running in active-active mode, you cannot configure stateful NAT where asymmetrical paths might cause issues. For active-active routers, you can use reflexive NAT"

questions.question_text:
An NSX administrator is creating a NAT rule on a Tier-0 Gateway configured in active-active high availability mode.
Which NAT rule type is supported for this configuration?

discussion.content:
Answer "A" is correct:

"Only VMXNET3 vNIC is supported for the NSX Edge VM"
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-T-Data-Center/3.0/installation/GUID-22F87CA8-01A9-4F2E-B7DB-9350CA60EA4E.html

questions.question_text:
An NSX administrator has been tasked with deploying a NSX Edge Virtual machine through an ISO image.
Which virtual network interface card (vNIC) type must be selected while creating the NSX Edge VM to allow participation in overlay and VLAN transport zones?
